questions.text: Which of the following best describes a toe deformity where there is hyperextension at the metatarsophalangeal joint, flexion at the proximal interphalangeal joint, and flexion at the distal interphalangeal joint?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Claw toe These features describe claw toe deformity These features describe claw toe deformity. A hammer toe is only flexed at the proximal interphalangeal joint and a mallet toe is only flexed at the distal interphalangeal joint. A bunionette is characterized by the prominence of the fifth metatarsal head.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B. A hammer toe is only flexed at the proximal interphalangeal joint Option: C. A mallet t oe is only flexed at the distal interphalangeal joint. Option: D. Not a curly toe.

questions.text: A 41-year-old man complains of heel pain, which is worse in the morning, better during the day, and bad again in the evenings:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Plantar fasciitis Plantar fasciitis is a common cause of heel pain. The characteristic feature is medial heel pain, which is worse first thing in the morning, improves as the day goes on then worsens again in the evening. Treatment includes Achilles and local plantar fascial stretching, cushioning of the heel, and night splints. Resistant cases may benefit from shockwave therapy or surgical release with plantar fasciotomy.

Highyeild:

Plantar fasciitis is a common cause of heel pain . The characteristic feature is medial heel pain, which is worse first thing in the morning, improves as the day goes on then worsens again in the evening. Treatment includes Achilles and local plantar fascial stretching , cushioning of the heel, and night splints. Resistant cases may benefit from shockwave therapy or surgical release with plantar fasciotomy. PLANTAR FASCITIS This is a common cause of pain in the heel. It occurs as a result of inflammation of the plantar aponeurosis at its attachment on the tuberosity of the calcaneum (Fig-36.6). The pain is worst early in the morning, and often improves with activity. On examination, there is marked tenderness over the medial aspect of the calcaneal tuberosity, at the site of attachment of the plantar fascia. X-rays sometimes show a sharp bone spur projecting forwards from the tuberosity of the calcaneum. Its significance is doubtful since it is also found in some cases without heel pain. Analgesics, the use of a heel pad and local induction of steroids brings relief in most cases.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B. Flexor hallucis longus impingement is not associated with heel pain and above history. Option: C. Gout does not present classically in the heel. Option: D. Morton’s neuroma does not present in the heel.

questions.text: All the following are causes of painful arc syndrome at the shoulder except?
questions.correct_answer: D. Rupture of the biceps tendon
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Rupture of the biceps tendon Rupture of the biceps tendon is not the cause of painful arc syndrome.

Highyeild:

PAINFUL ARC SYNDROME It is a clinical syndrome in which there is pain in the shoulder and upper arm during the mid-range of glenohumeral abduction. Common causes: Minor tears of the supraspinatus tendon Supraspinatus tendinitis Calcification of supraspinatus tendon Subacromial bursitis Fracture of the greater tuberosity

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Supraspinatus tendonitis is the cause of painful arc syndrome. Option: B. Subacromial bursitis is the cause of painful arc syndrome. Option: C. Fracture of the greater tuberosity is the cause of painful arc syndrome

questions.text: The following are true about Dupuytren’s contracture except?

options.label: A
options.text: Inherited as an autosomal dominant trait

options.label: B
options.text: High incidence in epileptics receiving phenytoin sodium

options.label: C
options.text: Most common in Ring and little finger

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Condition confined to skin Dupuytren contracture the aponeurosis or a part of it becomes thickened and slowly contracts, drawing the fingers into flexion at the metacarpophalangeal and proximal interphalangeal joints.

Highyeild:

DUPUYTREN'S CONTRACTURE (Contracture of the palmar aponeurosis) This is a condition characterised by a flexion deformity of one or more fingers due to a thickening and shortening of the palmar aponeurosis. The cause is unknown, but a hereditary predisposition has been established. There is an increased incidence of the disorder among cirrhotic patients and in epileptics on sodium hydantoin. CLINICAL FEATURES In early stages, thickening of the palmar aponeurosis is felt at the bases of ring and little fingers. Later, a flexion deformity of the fingers develops. Dupuytren's contracture can be differentiated from a similar deformity due to contracture of the flexor tendons; in the former only the MP and PIP joints are flexed, unlike the latter where the DIP joints are also flexed. TREATMENT An elderly patient with mild contracture does not need any treatment. If the deformity is significant and hampers the activity of the patient, excision of the palmar aponeurosis (subtotal excision) may be required.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Dupuytren’s contracture is inherited as an autosomal dominant trait Option: B. Dupuytren’s contracture risk factors include Cirrhotic patients, Epileptics on sodium hydantoin Option: C. Dupuytren contracture is common in people of European (Anglo-Saxon) descent

questions.text: All the following are true regarding plantar fasciitis except?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the most common cause of heel pain

options.label: B
options.text: It occurs as a result of inflammation of the plantar aponeurosis at its attachment to the calcaneal tuberosity

options.label: C
options.text: The pain is most severe in the noon and worsens with rest

options.label: D
options.text: Local steroid injection gives relief in most cases

questions.correct_answer: C. The pain is most severe in the noon and worsens with rest
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The pain is most severe in the noon and worsens with rest The pain is worst early in the morning and often improves with activity.

Highyeild:

Plantar Fasciitis It is a common cause of pain in the heel. It occurs as a result of inflammation of the plantar aponeurosis at its attachment to the tuberosity of the calcaneum. The pain is worst early in the morning and often improves with activity. On examination , there is marked tenderness over the medial aspect of the calcaneal tuberosity, at the site of attachment of the plantar fascia X-rays sometimes show a sharp bone spur projecting forwards from the tuberosity of the calcaneum. Treatment : Analgesics, the use of a heel pad, and local induction of steroids bring relief in most cases.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. It is the most common cause of heel pain Option: B. It occurs as a result of inflammation of the plantar aponeurosis at its attachment on the calcaneal tuberosity Option: D. - Local steroid injection gives relief in most cases

questions.text: Which of the following is not true of Dupuytren’s disease?

options.label: B
options.text: Painful nodules are an indication for surgery

options.label: C
options.text: Metacarpophalangeal joint (MCPJ) contracture of greater than 30º is an indication for surgery

options.label: D
options.text: Myofibroblasts are the offending cells in the etiology of the disease

questions.correct_answer: B. Painful nodules are an indication for surgery
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Painful nodules are an indication for surgery Painful nodules are not an indication for surgery in Dupuytren’s disease.

Highyeild:

The disease is usually in its early phases. The stages, according to Luck’s classification, are proliferative, involutional, and finally residual. Early surgery will certainly lead to recurrence and can stimulate the disease process. Carpal tunnel surgery must be performed on a separate occasion for a similar reason. Unfortunately, in the long term recurrence rates are high (50%).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Dupuytren’s disease in the long term has high recurrence rates (50%). Option: C. Metacarpophalangeal joint (MCPJ) contracture of greater than 30º is an indication for surgery in Dupuytren’s disease. Option: D. Myofibroblasts are the offending cells in the etiology of the disease

questions.text: Which of the following is not associated with a higher incidence of Dupuytren’s contracture?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Female sex Approximately 70% of cases of Dupuytren’s contracture occur in men.

Highyeild:

DUPUYTREN'S CONTRACTURE (Contracture of the palmar aponeurosis) This is a condition characterised by a flexion deformity of one or more fingers due to a thickening and shortening of the palmar aponeurosis. The cause is unknown, but a hereditary predisposition has been established. There is an increased incidence of the disorder among cirrhotic patients and in epileptics on sodium hydantoin. CLINICAL FEATURES In early stages, thickening of the palmar aponeurosis is felt at the bases of ring and little fingers. Later, a flexion deformity of the fingers develops. Dupuytren's contracture can be differentiated from a similar deformity due to contracture of the flexor tendons; in the former only the MP and PIP joints are flexed, unlike the latter where the DIP joints are also flexed. TREATMENT An elderly patient with mild contracture does not need any treatment. If the deformity is significant and hampers the activity of the patient, excision of the palmar aponeurosis (subtotal excision) may be required.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Anglo-Saxon descent is associated with a higher incidence of Dupuytren’s contracture Option: C. Epilepsy is associated with a higher incidence of Dupuytren’s contracture Option: D. Diabetes mellitus is associated with a higher incidence of Dupuytren’s contracture Approximately 70% of cases of Dupuytren’s contracture occur in men.
